div1.p: Kean corrects a mistake made in the spelling of Andrus's name. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Memorandum from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, April 21, 1930
div1.p:
MEMORANDUM FOR COLONEL A. E. TRUBY, NC USA.,
S. G. O.,

With reference to the given name of Private John H. Andrus I find
his name is given as John H. in -

list.item:
1. All the publications of the Yellow Fever Commission and in the
memorandum from the Surgeon General's office prepared by me and published
in connection with the publications of the Board and other documents as
Senate Document 822, 61st Congress, 3rd session
2. In H.R. 11685, March 2, 1928 introduced by Mr. Wainwright.

3. In the statement of General Ireland at the hearing before the
Committee on Military Affairs, House of Representatives, April 11, 1928.

5. In the records obtained by the S.G.O. from the A.G.O. and trans-
mitted to me April 16, 1928.

6. In the address of General Ireland at Indianapolis, Jan. 19, 1929.
(Data furnished by J.R.K.).
7. In H.R. 13060 as introduced in the Senate of U.S., January 26, 1929.

div1.p:
In Mr. Frothingham's report from the Committee on Military Affairs,
April 30, 1928, page 5, his name appears as John A. Andrus. This error in
the middle name was apparently taken from a memorandum furnished by me to
Hon. John M. Morin, 18 April, 1928, in which A was manifestly a clerical
error for H.

Private Andrus' name appears as James A. Andrus for the first time,
as far as my records show, in the Act as approved by the President, 28 February,
1929 ( Public - No. 858 - 70th Congress - H.R. 13060).

How the change was made I have neither any recollection or record.
It was followed by me in the memorandum which I prepared for the Surgeon
General to send to the Adjutant General for the Roll of Honor, 25 March,
1929, and a fuller memorandum prepared by me 27 August, 1929. The name
appears to have been corrected either in the S.G.O. or upon reaching the
A.G.O., and is published correctly in the Army Register, 1930, page 1103,
xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx as Andrus, John H.

J. R. KEAN,
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retd.
JRK/F
